messages.content: You are a helpful, concise assistant.
Explain what a binary heap is.

A binary heap is an array-based complete binary tree that supports O(log n) insert and extract-min/max; it maintains the heap-order property so each parent is ≤ (min-heap) or ≥ (max-heap) its children.
Give me Python code to push and pop using heapq.

Use the built-in heapq module:
```python
import heapq
h=[]
heapq.heappush(h, 3)
heapq.heappush(h, 1)
heapq.heappush(h, 2)
print(heapq.heappop(h))  # 1
```
